item.title: Parking obstruction of public footpath, 3rd November
item.description:
Cars at Park on this for court are apparently legally entitled to do so as long as their wheels are on the private property however I want to lodge a objection in this case because the vehicles protrude dangerously into the footpath. Prams wheelchair users and the public are often pushed into the road to get past at this point something needs to be done to protect the general public here. Vehicles are focused on negotiating the roundabout at this point so many times I have seen very near Mrs involving pedestrians and vehicles. Please can something be done to change the ruling here making it safer for the general public using the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I received a message to say this area had been cleared it hasn’t same litter inc the big plastic sheet I sent last week and the peel and Tom ketchup packets I sent last week too. This area is constantly neglected by Bromley and I’m unhappy there is an app which says the matter is resolved when it isn’t? Please clear the area of litter or put a bin at the bus stop. However that today and last week would not remove the large plastic sheet, 3rd November

item.title: Please ask the cleaning team to deep clean the Peckham High Street, 3rd November
item.description:
Unfortunately Peckham High Street is very dirty and messy and even has filthy environment when we walk on the pavements of Peckham High Street. Please ask the cleaning team to clean the pavements and roads with great attention to detail. Hopefully cleaning team will clean all the areas of Peckham and surrounding areas with very good professional attitude from now on. Thank you in advance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old bench slats broken - Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground, 3rd November
item.description:
Two old seat slats have broken on one of the benches on the eastern side of the pavilion, overlooking the middle terrace at Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground. The older upper back slat is also damaged. Please could these be replaced? (This bench had two new slats fitted some time ago which are still in good condition.)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 kids have sprayed our shutter in August 22nd 2025., 3rd November
item.description:
I was not aware that instead of tackling the cause of the problem the council expects me to be liable for removing what these kind of people keep on doing everywhere everyday... Anyway, having said this I appreciate there is a service that is advertised as free of charge (I pay all of my taxes). What I don't understand is why at the end of the page there is a threat to me stating that I could have to pay a fixed penalty or even getting criminal proceedings against me. Bizarre. I wish the council would treat the right people this way and not the ones investing, working and contributing. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Druid Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
